title: What is Node.js and How It Works
description: Understand Node.js as a JavaScript runtime built on V8 engine, its event-driven architecture, and single-threaded event loop model.

title: Modules and npm Package Manager
description: Learn about CommonJS modules, require/module.exports, npm, package.json, and managing dependencies.

title: File System (fs) Module
description: Master file operations including reading, writing, deleting files. Learn callback vs promises vs streams for file handling.

title: HTTP Server and Web Basics
description: Create HTTP servers, handle requests/responses, understand status codes and headers.

title: Event Emitter Pattern
description: Understand EventEmitter, event listeners, emitting events, and the observer pattern in Node.js.

title: Streams and Buffers
description: Learn readable, writable, and transform streams for efficient data handling. Understand backpressure and piping.

title: Async Patterns: Callbacks, Promises, Async/Await
description: Master asynchronous programming patterns in Node.js including error handling and flow control.

title: Working with JSON and Environment Variables
description: Parse and stringify JSON, work with environment variables using .env files and process.env.

title: Debugging Node.js Applications
description: Learn debugging techniques including console methods, node debugger, Chrome DevTools, and logging strategies.

title: Building Command Line Interface (CLI) Applications
description: Create CLI tools with argument parsing, colors, progress bars, and interactive prompts.
